[Stomach ache](https://www.thehealthsite.com/diseases-conditions/15-causes-of-abdominal-pain-259537/) or abdominal pain can result from indigestion, constipation, acidity, gas, [irritable bowel syndrome,](https://www.thehealthsite.com/diseases-conditions/irritable-bowel-syndrome-5-surprising-triggers-behind-this-condition-722211/) food allergies, lactose intolerance, food poisoning, a stomach virus, or [menstrual cramps](https://www.thehealthsite.com/diseases-conditions/diseases-conditions-womens-health/menstrual-cramps-disrupting-your-life-these-home-remedies-may-give-you-some-relief-718946/) if you're a woman. While most issues responsible for stomach ache are not a cause for concern, others can point to more serious medical problems like pancreatic diseases, ulcers or [gallstones](https://www.thehealthsite.com/photo-gallery/diseases-conditions-natural-remedies-to-deal-with-gallstones-657551/) that need medical treatment. Stomach pain that is not serious can be easily treated with over-the-counter medicines or home remedies. So, what do you do when you suffer from stomach ache? You may look for allopathy medicines to ease the pain. But these medicines cause many side effects. So, next time you feel pain in your stomach, try [Ayurvedic medicines,](https://www.thehealthsite.com/diseases-conditions/5-reasons-to-embrace-ayurveda-667576/) which are completely natural and mostly free of any side-effects. One of the most popular Ayurvedic treatments for stomach ache is the [asafoetida](https://www.thehealthsite.com/photo-gallery/diet-6-reasons-why-you-should-have-asafoetida-daily-ai0818-596290/hing--596300/) decoction, which is called Heungashtak. Keep reading to know how you can prepare this decoction at home. Ayurvedic experts say this homemade Ayurvedic asafoetida decoction can provide relief from [ acidity,](https://www.thehealthsite.com/diseases-conditions/10-home-remedies-for-acidity-that-really-work-77244/) stomach gas and stomach cramps in just five minutes. This remedy is beneficial for people of all ages, including babies. Here's what you need to make this magic potion: Parsley - 1/2 tsp Shepa (Sage Flour Seed) - 1/2 tsp Asafoetida - 1/4 tsp Black salt - as per taste Mulethi: 1 small piece 1 cm Dry Ginger- one piece Put all these ingredients in a container with 250 ml of water and boil it for about five minutes. Strain it and drink this decoction half an hour after having your meal. It will improve your [digestive system](https://www.thehealthsite.com/fitness/diet/malaika-arora-swears-by-methi-and-jeera-water-to-keep-her-digestive-system-healthy-757419/) and relieve [abdominal pain](https://www.thehealthsite.com/diseases-conditions/your-stomach-pain-could-be-a-warning-sign-of-diverticulitis-a-form-of-colitis-that-may-require-surgery-750597/).
